questions.text: Which of the following combinations of features are characteristic of smooth muscle tissue?

options.label: D
options.text: Voltage-gated calcium channels and calmodulin present

questions.correct_answer: D. Voltage-gated calcium channels and calmodulin present
questions.explanation:
Smooth muscles

Skeletal muscles

Spindle-shaped, single nucleated cells.

Multiple nucleated cells.

Neuromuscular junction is not present.

Proper neuromuscular junction is present.

Caveolae is present. (Option B ruled out)

T-tubule is present. (Option B ruled out)

Predominantly, calcium channels are present.

Predominantly, sodium channels are present.

Actin and myosin are not properly organised.

Actin and myosin are properly organised.

A dense body is present.

The Z- line is present. (Option A ruled out)

Calmodulin is present, and Titin is absent. (Option C ruled out)

Troponin (Option A ruled out) and Titin (Option C ruled out) are present.

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of multi-unit smooth muscle?

options.label: A
options.text: Fibers arranged in sheets or bundles

options.label: B
options.text: Fibers contract as a single unit

questions.explanation:
Characteristic

Multi-Unit Smooth Muscle

Unitary (Single-Unit) Smooth Muscle

Structure

Discrete, separate fibres.

(Option C)

Fibers arranged in sheets or bundles (Option A ruled out)

Innervation

Often innervated by single nerve-ending.

Less dependent on nerve signals.

Contraction

Fibers contract independently.

Fibers contract as a single unit. (Option B ruled out)

Cell Connections

Covered by a basement membrane, insulated

Connected by gap junctions (Option D ruled out)

Control

Mainly by nerve signals.

Mainly by non-nervous stimuli.

Signal Propagation

Limited between fibres.

Action potentials can spread between fibres.

Examples

Ciliary muscle, iris muscle, and piloerector muscles.

The gastrointestinal tract, bile ducts, ureters, uterus, and many blood vessels.

Also Known As
  •  

Syncytial smooth muscle, visceral smooth muscle.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the conduction of action potentials is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Speed of action potential conduction is inversely proportional to the degree of myelination of the axon.

options.label: B
options.text: Saltatory conduction occurs in both myelinated and unmyelinated axons.

options.label: C
options.text: The action potential jumps from one node of Ranvier to the next in myelinated axons.

options.label: D
options.text: The myelin sheath increases the flow of ions across the axonal membrane.

questions.correct_answer: C. The action potential jumps from one node of Ranvier to the next in myelinated axons.
questions.explanation:
Conduction of action potential

Feature

Unmyelinated

Myelinated

Conduction Speed

Slower (0.25 m/s)

Faster (up to 100 m/s)

Mechanism

Action potential flows continuously along the axon membrane. (Option B)

Action potential "jumps" between nodes of Ranvier-saltatory conduction.

Myelin Sheath

Absent

Present, decreases flow of ions, preventing ion leakage across the membrane. (Option D)

Nodes of Ranvier

Absent

Present, rapid action potential regeneration.

Energy Efficiency

Less energy efficient.

More energy efficient.

Fiber Diameter

Smaller

Larger

questions.text: Match the labeled parts of the sarcomere (A, B, C, D, E) with their correct names. 1. Z-line 2. I-band 3. M-line 4. A-band 5. H-zone
Which statement best describes the length-tension relationship in skeletal muscle?

options.label: A
options.text: The maximum tension is generated when the sarcomere length is 1.6 μm.

options.label: B
options.text: The number of cross-bridges and the tension generated decrease when the sarcomere length exceeds 2.2 μm.

options.label: C
options.text: Passive tension contributes to muscle tension even when the sarcomere length is optimal.

options.label: D
options.text: The sarcomere ruptures when the length exceeds 2.2 μm.

questions.correct_answer: B. The number of cross-bridges and the tension generated decrease when the sarcomere length exceeds 2.2 μm.

questions.text: Which statement accurately describes the types of heat generated during muscle contraction and relaxation?

options.label: A
options.text: Resting heat is produced during relaxation; activation heat during contraction.

options.label: B
options.text: Activation heat is produced during relaxation; shortening heat during rest.

options.label: C
options.text: Resting heat is produced at rest; activation, shortening, and relaxation heat during various phases of muscle activity.

options.label: D
options.text: Shortening heat is produced during rest; relaxation heat during contraction.

questions.correct_answer: C. Resting heat is produced at rest; activation, shortening, and relaxation heat during various phases of muscle activity.

questions.text: Feedback control in voltage-gated ion channels in the membrane of neuron during action potential has been shown here. The phenomenon shown at point A is:
Graph below is showing simple muscle twitch in frog gastrocnemius muscle. Calculate tetanising frequency of this muscle.

Electrical activity of individual muscle cells in the guinea pig is recorded. Sinusoidal fluctuation of membrane potential with firing on the rising phase of each wave is identified from the recording. Identify the muscle type:
